title: Safe Border Crossing to Friendly Territory
brief: Cross international borders safely when evading to friendly or neutral countries.
steps: Step 1: Establish hide site on near side of border.
Step 2: Send team to reconnoiter potential crossing site.
Step 3: Surveil crossing site for at least 24 hours, noting terrain, obstacles, guard routines.
Step 4: Make sketch of site including sensor devices and trip wires.
Step 5: Plan to cross border at night after reconnaissance is complete.
Step 6: After crossing, establish hide site on far side and locate friendly positions.
Step 7: Have two personnel surveil potential linkup site until satisfied forces are friendly.
Step 8: Make contact during daylight with unarmed person who looks least like enemy.
Step 9: Contact person approaches with positive identification readily available.
warnings: Crossing into neutral country means surrendering and becoming a detained person.
Border areas typically have enhanced security and sensor devices.
Guard rotations and routines must be thoroughly understood before attempting crossing.
Have contingency plan for language problems or identity verification difficulties.
